properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 16 at 1:14PM MST until February 17 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...SIGNIFICANT MOUNTAIN SNOWFALL EXPECTED THROUGH MONDAY...

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches.
Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. Areas of blowing snow
reducing visibility under one half mile at times.

* WHERE...Interstate 80 Corridor between Laramie and Rawlins
from mile markers 280 to 252.

* WHEN...Until 7 PM MST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Slick roads and reduced visibility. The hazardous
conditions will impact the morning and evening commute.
Blowing snow will reduce visibility at times.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST MONDAY
